title: Group-averaged Markov chains II: tuning of group action in finite state space
summary: We study group-averaged Markov chains obtained by augmenting a $π$-stationary transition kernel $P$ with a group action on the state space via orbit kernels. Given a group $\mathcal{G}$ with orbits $(\mathcal{O}_i)_{i=1}^k$, we analyse three canonical orbit kernels: namely the Gibbs $(G)$, Metropolis-Hastings $(M)$, and Barker $(B)$ kernels, as well as their multiplicative sandwiches $QPQ$ and the additive mixtures $\frac{1}{2}(P+Q)$ where $Q\in\{G,M,B\}$.
